Ingest Student Data Extract

Source: R/ingest.R
ingest_student_data_extract.Rd

Ingest an SOL student data extract (csv file). This should be the exact file downloaded from Pearson. This function reads the data in and performs some light cleaning.

Usage

ingest_student_data_extract(
  path,
  clean_test_names = TRUE,
  writing_extract = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

path

Character. The path to the file to be ingested.

clean_test_names

Logical. If TRUE (the default), test names will be cleaned using clean_test_names(), which strips out the standard year and the " CAT" suffix where applicable.

writing_extract

Logical. If TRUE, will assume the file is a student data extract for writing tests. If FALSE (the default), will assume the file is a student data extract for non-writing tests. )

...

Additional arguments passed to readr::read_csv()

Value

A dataframe containing the ingested data.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
p <- "path/to/my/data.csv"
df <- ingest_student_data_extract(p)
} # }
